page.description: Javascript Actions enable you to call Action Javascript anywhere you can use JavaScript in the Grid Component.

discussion.p: Defining Javascript Actions is similar to defining Javascript Functions for your Grid Component, except that you can use the Action Javascript builder to write the Javascript code rather than hand-coding your function. The Actions that you define can be called by various event handlers in the Grid Component.

section.important: Action names must be unique. Action names are also case-sensitive.

description.p: Some actions that you define using Action Javascript need to know what object invoked the action. For example, if you define an action that *[ui:opens a window]* and you want the window positioned *[ui:relative]* to the button that invokes the action, a reference object is required.

In order for the *[ui:opens a window]* action to work, the [{grid.object}.runAction()] method needs a reference to the invoking object. This is done by passing a pointer to the object as the second parameter to the [.runAction()] method.
